titleStmt.title: An answer to VVithers motto Without a frontispice. Wherein, Nec habeo, nec careo, nec curo, are neither approued, nor confuted: but modestly controuled, or qualified.
titleStmt.author: T. G., Esquire.
Gainsford, Thomas, d. 1624?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Lichfield, and William Turner,

notesStmt.note: Signed on A4v: T.G. Esquire, i.e. Thomas Gainsford?.
A reply to: Wither, George. Withers motto.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
